definition: adverse audience reaction: boos and jeers, hissing, catcalls or deliberate applause after a mistake
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
(bright) color/variety/applause/applaud/lottery prize
to boo or jeer (as a sign of displeasure at an actor)
jeering/booing/catcalls

sentences.english: After a moment the barracking began.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，倒彩声开始响起。

sentences.english: The actors were booed off the stage .
sentences.chinese: 演员被倒彩声轰下了台。

sentences.english: Don't be afraid of cat calls, that's the key to success.
sentences.chinese: 不要害怕被人喝倒彩，这是成功的关键。

sentences.english: No matter how poorly he acts, you should never give him cat calls.
sentences.chinese: 无论他的表演有多糟糕，你都不应该给他喝倒彩。

sentences.english: The audience hissed when the actor forgot his lines.
sentences.chinese: 演员忘了台词，观众开始喝倒彩。

sentences.english: They barracked the speaker during the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他们在会上不断地喝倒彩。

sentences.english: The audience hooted until the performer fled the stage in disgrace.
sentences.chinese: 观众们不断发嘘声，喝倒彩，羞得演员赶快溜下舞台。

sentences.english: The audience shouted down the unpopular actress off the stage.
sentences.chinese: 观众大喝倒彩，将那位不受欢迎的演员撵下了舞台。

sentences.english: The minister started to speak but students in the audience shouted him down.
sentences.chinese: 大臣开始演讲，但听众中的学生喝他的倒彩。
观众向那个演员喝倒彩。

sentences.english: He sang so badly that the audience booed him.
sentences.chinese: 他唱得实在太糟糕了，观众向他喝倒彩。

definition: to boo or jeer (as a sign of displeasure at an actor)
acclaim/cheer
hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
to applaud/to cheer
everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
off the stage/in the audience
to cheer for/to acclaim
boisterous/uproarious
the whole room roaring with laughter (idiom)
to curse/to berate angrily
to verbally abuse
to scold
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to drink as the result of having lost a bet
